intro: Atalaya annularis, commonly known as the ringed atalaya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive ring-like patterns on its leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riverine forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
